body:
[spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4828922/spack-build-env.txt)
It was observed that although libflame installation is successful for latest version 5.2.0 but fails for 5.1.0 version

### Steps to reproduce the issue
```console
1. git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
2. cd spack
3. source spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
4. spack install libflame@5.1.0 
...
```

### Information on your system
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1528-577a88880
* **Python:** 3.7.5
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu19.10-zen2
$

### Additional information
<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any 
[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4828892/spack-build-out.txt)
config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-out.txt]()
* [spack-build-env.txt]()

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [ ] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: libflame installation fails for 5.1.0 version
